content: w h i d b e y i s l a n d b e a n i e a simple ribbed hat to fit any adult fairlight fibers | fairlightfibers com whidbey island beanie | fairlight fibers | fairlightfibers com whidbey island beanie | fairlight fibers | fairlightfibers com sometimes the best things in life are astonishingly simple this easy hat is about as basic as they come just 1x1rib with a neat row of knit stitches to decorate the edge of the folded rim simple decreases are spaced to keep the hat from rising up or being too pointy it s basic beautiful and squishy-warm perfect for gifts quick knits and soon to be your favorite staple the whidbey island beanie is knit in the round from 60-70 grams of worsted or light aran-weight yarn and can be made from a variety of fibers shown here west yorkshire spinners the croft in clousta jess s cover hat or mossbank joe s hat stonehedge fiber mill shepherd s wool worsted in sage shelli s hat subculture yarn sw merino worsted in blue camas jess s second hat the hat is knit in one size which will stretch to fit a head from 15 to well bigger than any head we measured jess wears a 22 hat joe and shelli are wearing theirs at 24 but it s all the same hat joe s hat features a slightly longer brim which works nicely for those with larger hat sizes whidbey island beanie | fairlight fibers | fairlightfibers com sizes one size 15-24 head and beyond gauge 18sts = 4 in ribbing needles 16 us 7 4 50mm and dpns us 7 4 50mm for crown or size needed to obtain gauge materials 120-150 yards of worsted or aran weight yarn you will also need a stitch marker abbreviations k2tog = knit 2 together whidbey island beanie | fairlight fibers | fairlightfibers com pattern cast on 88 stitches onto us7 join in the round being careful not to twist brim work in k1 p1 ribbing for 2 5 for a longer brim knit for 3 knit 1 row main hat body continue in k1 p1 ribbing for 6 more crown decreases round 1 *work in pattern for 6 stitches k2tog* repeat around round 2 * k1 p1 3 times k1* repeat around round 3 k1 p1 3 times k2tog * p1 k1 2 times p1 k2tog* to last stitch which should have been part of the last k2tog slip this stitch to the right needle remove your stitch marker and slip the stitch back into left needle k2tog replace marker after the k2tog this is now the beginning of the round round 4 p1 *k1 p1* repeat around ending with a k1 round 5 *p1 k1 p1 k1 k2tog* repeat around round 6 *p1 k1 p1 k2* repeat around round 7 *p1 k1 p1 k2tog* repeat around round 8 *p1 k1* repeat around round 9 *p1 k1 k2tog* repeat around round
